N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 700.2 - Importance of decorum in court

State Regulations

The courtroom, as the place where
justice is dispensed, must at all times satisfy the appearance as well as the
reality of fairness and equal treatment. Dignity, order and decorum are
indispensable to the proper administration of justice. Disruptive conduct by
any person while the court is in session is forbidden. Notes
